p.s: I am writing to you in response to the interview with Ayad Akhtar which has only recently been published in Guernica Magazine.
I want to talk about the sentence of Ayad Akhtar where he says: faith being one's main identity marker.
I think there is a lot of trueness in this sentence.
In this generation, being faithful expresses much more than it did a few years ago, just because there are many people that are not faithful anymore.
In the early 18th century, religion was a way to life.
It was more than just a decision.
Almost everyone was faithful and people who were not, were a shame.
The new perspectives on bioligybiology, chemistry and physics changed the way to look at religion completely.
Now it was proven, that the human being comes from the monkey by evolution - not by a god who created them.
Religion gets much less and is harder to find but if you find someone who is true faithful, it is still different.
Thank you for the interview with Ayad Akhtar, it was very interesting.
